channel.title: Fur Trade Days
channel.description: Recent content on Fur Trade Days

item.title: Mac's Carnival
item.description: Building on the great experience attendees had last year, Fur Trade Days is excited to welcome back Mac’s Carnival for 2020!

item.title: Entertainment!
item.description: Lincoln’s Lazerwolfe is planned to take the stage Friday night, while Dylan Bloom is slated for Saturday night.

item.title: Traders' Market
item.description: The Chadron Fur Trade Days Traders’ Market features merchants from around the area and across the country, and provides something for everyone. The 44th annual attraction is planned to remain at the crowd-favorite Dawes County Courthouse Lawn and boasts a slate of new merchants as well as familiar favorites!

item.title: Lions Club FTD Parade
item.description: The 44th Annual Lions Club Fur Trade Days Parade starts at 10 a.m. on Saturday, July 11 and proceeds down Main Street from Tenth to First streets. Candy and other goodies will be passed out along the parade route. Come early to claim a good seat and enjoy the excitement!

item.title: Activities and More
item.description: The String Beans play a kid-friendly show Friday evening at the courthouse lawn. Saturday, mini golf starts off all-ages, then moves to night play in the 200 block of Main St.

item.title: Buckskinner's Camp
item.description: The Bordeaux Creek Fur Trade and Muzzleloading Association’s Rendezvous, located 3.5 miles east and 8 miles south of Chadron, is expected to open Thursday, July 9, for camp setup.

item.title: Forms
item.description: Entry forms, event signups, and posters will appear here.

item.title: Reunions
item.description: CHS Class of 2010, 10 Year Reunion CHS Class of 2000, 20 Year Reunion CHS Class of 1990, 30 Year Reunion CHS Class of 1980, 40 Year Reunion ​To list your reunion information, email info@furtradedays.com.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Schedule updated as events are confirmed. Wednesday, July 8 Thursday, July 9 Friday, July 10 Saturday, July 11 Time Event Location 10 a.m. 44th Annual Lions Club Parade Main Street, runs north from 10th to 1st street After Parade — Chamber Ambassadors’ Buffalo BBQ Courthouse Lawn 11 a.m. – 1 p.m. Bald Mountain Rounders Courthouse Lawn Gazebo Sunday, July 12

item.title: Museum of The Fur Trade
item.description: The Museum of the Fur Trade is located on the James Bordeaux trading post, which has become an important historical site over the years. The trading post was established in the fall of 1837 as a site for the American Fur Company to conduct business with American Indians who spent their winters in the area. Traders, Trappers, and Indians The Museum of the Fur Trade is dedicated to preserving the rich history of the North American fur trade.

item.title: Our History
item.description: Northwest Nebraska The Community of Chadron and all of Northwest Nebraska welcomes you to the unforgettably unique celebration of Fur Trade Days. Chadron, located in the northwest corner of Nebraska, was named for the French fur trader Louis Baptiste Chartran. This event offers a weekend filled with history, rendezvous, entertainment, down-home hospitality, great food, and lots of fun! There is something for everyone and a chance to see neighbors and make new friends.
